message.content: Salvia leucophylla is a species of flowering plant native to California. It is commonly known as purple sage or gray sage. The plant typically has a shrub-like growth habit and can reach heights of up to 6 feet. The leaves are a distinctive grayish-green color and have a fuzzy texture. The flowers grow in clusters at the end of the stem and are a light lavender-purple color, with a tube-like shape. Salvia leucophylla is often used in landscaping and as a decorative plant due to its attractive appearance and drought-resistant nature. It can be found in a variety of habitats, including coastal sage scrub and chaparral ecosystems. Overall, its visual characteristics make it a recognizable and popular plant in its native region.
